skill.name: typescript-review
skill.description: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found in the scanned skill file. The content is limited to review guidance and command references.

content.user_title: Review TypeScript changes with Metabase standards
content.value_statement: Code reviews can miss style and quality issues in TypeScript changes. This skill guides you to spot them and suggest the right checks.
actual_capabilities: Review TypeScript and JavaScript diffs for Metabase coding standards
Identify style violations and code quality issues
Assess type safety and TypeScript usage
Evaluate React best practices when applicable
Recommend lint, format, type check, and test commands
limitations: Does not execute linting, formatting, or tests
Requires user provided diffs or file context
Focuses on TypeScript and JavaScript, including React
Does not replace a full security audit

use_cases.title: Review pull requests
use_cases.description: Scan TypeScript changes for style and quality issues before approval.

use_cases.title: Improve diff quality
use_cases.description: Get feedback on type safety and React patterns in new changes.

use_cases.title: Standardize reviews
use_cases.description: Apply consistent Metabase review criteria across the team.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this TypeScript diff for Metabase style and code quality issues. List any problems and quick fixes.

prompt_templates.title: JSDoc check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this change for missing or unclear JSDoc and suggest improvements that match Metabase standards.

prompt_templates.title: Type safety pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess type safety in this refactor. Call out any unsafe any usage or weak types and suggest stronger types.

prompt_templates.title: React best practices
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these React component changes for best practices and potential issues with hooks, props, or rendering.

output_examples.input: Review this TypeScript diff for style, type safety, and React best practices.
output: Flags missing JSDoc on exported function
Notes a weak any type that should be a union
Suggests memoizing a derived value to avoid extra renders

best_practices: Provide the full diff and any related context
Mention the area of the codebase and intended behavior
Confirm whether to focus on style, types, or React patterns
anti_patterns: Asking for review without providing the diff
Treating the review as a security audit

faq.question: Is this compatible with TypeScript and JavaScript?
faq.answer: Yes. It is designed for TypeScript and JavaScript changes, including React when present.

faq.question: What are the limits of the review?
faq.answer: It does not run code or tests. It only reviews the provided diff or files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI tools?
faq.answer: It can suggest commands, but it does not execute or integrate with CI systems.

faq.question: Does it access my files or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the content you provide in the prompt.

faq.question: What if the review seems too generic?
faq.answer: Provide more context such as files, intent, and expected behavior for better guidance.

faq.question: How does it compare to a linter?
faq.answer: It provides human style review guidance and cannot replace automated linting or testing.
